10.39.text:
00:08
COMM: Off the coast of South Africa, great

12.47.text:
white sharks are caught on camera, breaching
spectacularly as they hunt.

21.06.text:
00:33
COMM: This stunning footage was shot over

37.29.text:
several weeks by Mark van Coller of Atlantic
Edge films who used a decoy seal, towed twenty

43.88.text:
metres behind the boat to attract the apex
predators.

48.97.text:
00:52
COMM: The most active time for sharks to hunt

55.88.text:
seals in this way is just after sunrise, at
that time the seals form a distinct silhouette

61.82.text: for the sharks to aim at.

63.82.text:
But the water is darker for the predators
to remain unseen beneath the surface.

73.00.text:
01:23
COMM: It's impossible to predict when a sharp

86.00.text: will breach and the action is over in seconds.

90.66.text:
But the constant position of the dummy seal
gave Mark the best chance to film the great

95.36.text: whites as they broke the surface.

104.55.text:
01:51
COMM: On a good morning he could witness up

118.27.text:
Although it was quite common to spend a whole
hour without seeing anything.
